citations.narrative:
In the outdoor enclosure housing four coatis, there is no water present in either water bottle. When the facility
representative filled the first water bottle, one coati drank continuously for over three minutes. When the second water
bottle was filled, two different coatis fought over access to the water and drank from it for over two minutes. One coati was
seen panting and the temperature reading from the inspector’s Kestrel thermometer was 88 degrees Fahrenheit.
Inadequate access to potable water can cause discomfort and dehydration of the animals. The facility must provide
potable water as often as necessary for the health and comfort of the animals.
To be corrected by May 30, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.130  Direct
   
Watering. 
In the outdoor enclosure housing four coatis, there is no water present in either water bottle. When the facility 
representative filled the first water bottle, one coati drank continuously for over three minutes. When the second water 
bottle was filled, two different coatis fought over access to the water and drank from it for over two minutes. One coati was 
seen panting and the temperature reading from the inspector’s Kestrel thermometer was 88 degrees Fahrenheit.  
 
Inadequate access to potable water can cause discomfort and dehydration of the animals. The facility must provide 
potable water as often as necessary for the health and comfort of the animals. 
 
To be corrected by May 30, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
